MultipleChoice.Title: will and would
MultipleChoice.Instruction: What do you say in the following situations? Click on the correct answer.

Content.Question:
1. Your friend, Karen, has already eaten a box of chocolates. You think she should stop.If you eat any more, you'll be ill.
If you ate any more, you'd be ill.

2. Chris asks you to help him with a computer problem but you don't understand computers very well.I'll help you if I know more about computers
I'd help you if I knew more about computers.

3. George wants to speak to Brita but he can't find her. You offer to help.I'll tell her if I see her.
I'd tell her if I saw her.

4. You're on a skiing holiday and your friend Tim invites you to go snowboarding with him.I'll do it if I'm younger.
I'd do it if I were younger.

5. You are going to have a baby and your friend Helen asks you about the baby's name.If it's a girl, we'll call her Yvonne.
If it was a girl, we'd call her Yvonne.

6. Your manager asks you if you can do some extra work.I'll do it if I'm not so busy.
I'd do it if I weren't so busy.

7. Your brother doesn't like his job very much and he's beginning to think about the possibility of moving.Where will you go?
Where would you go?

8. Your mother is trying to carry a large suitcase.I'll carry that if you like.
I'd carry that if you liked.
